perturbation.original_text:
3. FEES

3.1 The Company will pay the Consultant basic remuneration for its services in the sum of $10,000 per month (the "Consulting Fee") commencing on the 1st day of February, 2020, and payable on the last day of each month thereafter up to and including the 31st day of January, 2025, together with any such increments thereto as the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors of the Company may from time to time determine. In addition, the Company will pay to the Consultant all reasonable expenses of the Consultant as agreed to from time to time which are incurred by the Consultant in delivery of the Services, based on monthly invoices submitted to the Company, including copies of all paid receipts; plus harmonized sales taxes or goods and services taxes, as the case may be, in addition to the Consulting Fees, which taxes will be remitted by the Consultant to the Canada Revenue Agency.
perturbation.changed_text:
3. FEES

3.1 The Company will pay the Consultant basic remuneration for its services in the sum that the Company deems appropriate based on performance reviews. The consulting fee will start being paid commencing on the 1st day of February, 2020. The payments will be remitted at the Company's discretion, following an invoice, up to and including the 31st day of January, 2025. The Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors of the Company may determine increments from time to time based on the performance review. The Company may pay to the Consultant expenses as agreed to from time to time. The Consultant must submit monthly invoices to the Company, including copies of all paid receipts, if requested. The Consultant is responsible for harmonized sales taxes or goods and services taxes, as the case may be, in addition to the Consulting Fees, which taxes will be remitted by the Consultant to the Canada Revenue Agency.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specified a fixed monthly consulting fee of $10,000. The modified version changes the base amount of the consulting fee to be based on performance reviews, subject to Company discretion. This creates uncertainty about the actual amount the Consultant will receive.

perturbation.changed_text:
5. TERMINATION

5.1 This Agreement can be terminated at any time prior to the expiry of the Term, as follows: (a) by the Consultant electing to give the Company not less than 3 months prior notice of such termination; (b) by the Company electing to give the Consultant 3 months prior notice of such termination without any termination payment; (c) The Company may terminate this agreement at any time and for any reason or no reason.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires the Company to provide a termination payment equal to the annual consulting fee if the Company elects to terminate the agreement. The modified version removes this payment obligation, creating a contradiction on the conditions of the payment obligations. The additional of the ability to terminate at any time creates a condition that could supersede the consultant's notice of termination.

perturbation.original_text:
6. CONFIDENTIALITY

6.1 The Consultant acknowledges and agrees that in the performance of its obligations under this Agreement, it may obtain knowledge of Confidential Information (as defined below) relating to the business or affairs of the Company or its affiliated companies (the "Affiliated Companies").

The Consultant and the Principal shall not, without the prior written consent of the Company, either during the Term or at any time thereafter: (a) use or disclose any Confidential Information outside of the Company or the Affiliated Companies;

(b) except in undertaking the Services, remove or aid in the removal from the premises of the Company or any of the Affiliated Companies any Confidential Information or any property or material relating thereto; or

(c) use the Confidential Information for any purpose other than in performing the Services.
perturbation.changed_text:
6. CONFIDENTIALITY

6.1 The Consultant acknowledges and agrees that in the performance of its obligations under this Agreement, it may obtain knowledge of Confidential Information (as defined below) relating to the business or affairs of the Company or its affiliated companies (the "Affiliated Companies").

The Consultant and the Principal may, either during the Term or at any time thereafter, use or disclose any Confidential Information outside of the Company or the Affiliated Companies, except in the case of performing conflicting Services or a Change of Control. The Consultant may remove or aid in the removal from the premises of the Company or any of the Affiliated Companies any Confidential Information or any property or material relating thereto; or

(c) use the Confidential Information for any purpose other than in performing the Services.
perturbation.explanation: The original text contains a strict confidentiality clause. The modified version includes an exemption allowing the Consultant to disclose confidential information outside of the Company in the event of conflicting services or a Change of Control. This directly contradicts the original non-disclosure obligation and creates uncertainty about the scope of confidentiality.
